title: Anthony Joshua posts first update since fatal car crash in Nigeria
body_text:
Anthony Joshua has posted his first social media update since the fatal car crash in Nigeria which killed two of his friends.
The 36-year-old was involved in a devastating crash on the Lagos-Ibadan expressway in Makun on Monday morning.
Joshua‚Äôs close friends and long-term members of his team Sina Ghami and Latif ‚ÄòLatz‚Äô Ayodele lost their lives in the tragic accident.
The funerals of the two men will take place today, Sunday January 4, at London Central Mosque.
It was confirmed that Joshua flew back to the UK on Saturday from Nigeria.
The two-time world heavyweight champion escaped with minor injuries and has posted on Instagram for the first time since the accident at the start of this week.
The Olympic gold medallist is pictured with family and friends, one of whom is holding a picture of Ghami.

Who were Anthony Joshua's friends Latif Ayodele and Sina Ghami?
Throughout his time in boxing, Anthony Joshua has kept a close-knit circle of friends and associates around him, plenty of those working silently behind the scenes during his ascent to the summit of the sport.
Both Ghami and Ayodele were part of that group, considered good friends having worked closely with him for years.
Who is Latif ‚ÄòLatz‚Äô Ayodele?
‚ÄòLatz‚Äô is a long-time friend of Joshua‚Äôs and has been part of the AJ team going all the way back to his maiden world title victory over Charles Martin in 2016.
Ayodele was Joshua‚Äôs personal trainer and a dedicated Muslim having converted to Isam in 2012.
His Instagram feed is littered with images and videos of him alongside Joshua in the gym and relaxing away from it.
Just hours before the crash, he shared a video on Instagram of him and Joshua smiling and laughing over a game of table tennis.
Latif worked with a number of other prominent sports men and women with New Zealand rugby legend Sonny Bill Williams among those paying tribute.
According to his Facebook profile, he attended St Joan of Arc Catholic School in Rickmansworth, a few miles from Joshua‚Äôs hometown of Watford.
Who is Sina Ghami?
Ghami was Joshua‚Äôs strength and conditioning coach, a role he held for more than a decade.
He was also the co-founder of Evolve Gym in London. Their website states Ghami was a qualified sports and exercise rehabilitator who specialises in musculoskeletal injuries and corrective exercise.
Ghami was at Joshua‚Äôs side throughout his career, including his crowning moment against Wladimir Klitschko at Wembley Stadium in 2017.
His last Instagram story appeared to be a shot of Joshua‚Äôs motorcade through Lagos.
The driver of the black Lexus SUV, Adeniyi Mobolaji Kayode, appeared at a hearing at Sagamu High Court at which he denied all charges against him including dangerous driving. He claims the brakes of the vehicle were not in working order, leading to the fatal crash.
His lawyer Olalekan Abiodun made the stunning revelation that Joshua was urged to move to the back seat of the car as his 6f 6in frame was blocking the wing mirror.

Joshua was discharged from hospital on New Year‚Äôs Eve. Joshua‚Äôs mother Yeta Odusanya rushed to her son‚Äôs bedside following the tragedy with the pair paying their respects to his ‚Äòdeparted friends‚Äô at a funeral home on Wednesday afternoon ahead of their repatriation to the UK.
